title: Faculty Development Institute Lectures
description: Lectures given to the faculty at VT in various formats.
contents:
Lectures given to the VT faculty through the VT Faculty Development
Institute. Formats are 1-2 hours and in one case was a 3 session
workshop.
Jan 2016 – Present Topics include:
R-Keras
Deep Learning Fundamentals for Computer Vision
Genomics Analysis on ARC
CUDA
Parallel R
R-gpus

title: STAT 4004 Spring 2019
description: Methods of Statistical Computing.  3 credit undergraduate couse.
contents:
Methods of Statistical Computing
Jan 2019 – May 2019
R based class focused on Reproducibile Research through Markdown and
git, programming principles, and Deep Learning fundamentals as a
destination.

title: STAT 5014 Fall 2019
description: Introduction to Statistical Computing.  1 credit Graduate course.
contents:
Introduction to Statistical Computing
Aug 2019 – Dec 2019
Topics include:
Reproducuble Research
Good Programming Practices
Latex/Markdown
Parallel computing
SAS
Python

title: STAT 5014 Fall 2020
description: Introduction to Statistical Computing.  1 credit Graduate course.
contents:
Introduction to Statistical Computing
Aug 2020 – Dec 2020
Topics include:
R and scripting
bash use
Git
Very basic introduction to Monte Carlo
Introduction to neural networks and Keras
Python

title: STAT 5014 Fall 2021
description: Introduction to Statistical Computing.  1 credit Graduate course.
contents:

title: STAT 5526 Fall 2020
description: A short description of the post.
contents:
Introduction to Statistical Computing
Aug 2020 – Dec 2020

bash use
high-performance computing, system design, interaction with
